office: House Committee on Science, Space, and Technology
key_responsibilities: acting as the clerk for each hearing
communicating with Member offices
managing the front office
answering phones
hiring and managing interns
maintaining correspondence system and Committee records
assisting staff with research
executing other administrative duties as needed
requirements: the ability to work under tight deadlines

key_responsibilities: managing the Member’s daily schedule
arranging travel
coordinating all Member level meetings and event requests
other duties as assigned
requirements: at least three years of experience as an executive assistant and/or scheduler/office manager
able to thrive in a fast paced work environment

key_responsibilities: responding to constituent mail
monitoring House floor procedures
assisting the legislative director with drafting legislation
meeting with constituents and interested individuals/organizations
preparing congressional record entries
assisting the communications director with updating the website and Facebook and Twitter pages
other duties as assigned
requirements: able to manage multiple tasks and work well under pressure
resident of, or be willing to become, a resident of the District of Columbia

key_responsibilities: assisting constituents by navigating complex casework through federal agencies in areas such as veterans affairs, social security, housing, and immigration
assessing casework and community activities for matters warranting legislative action
requirements: excellent written and oral communication skills
prior experience working for state or local government
fluency or strong verbal and written proficiency in Spanish
strong knowledge or connection with Riverside County and California’s 36th Congressional District

office: Democratic Staff of the House Committee on Small Business
key_responsibilities: handling procurement policy, with an emphasis on small business contracting issues
requirements: subject matter experience in federal set-aside programs, federal agency buying practices, and federal acquisition policy
experience with hearing preparation and legislative development

key_responsibilities: assisting constituents by navigating complex casework through federal agencies in areas such as veterans affairs, social security, housing, and immigration
assessing casework and community activities for matters warranting legislative action
requirements: excellent written and oral communication skills
prior experience working for state or local government
fluency or strong verbal and written proficiency in Spanish
strong knowledge or connection with Riverside County and California’s 36th Congressional District

position: Legislative Assistant, or Senior Legislative Assistant
key_responsibilities: handling work on the Financial Services Committee and other issues
requirements: substantial experience with financial services issues
strong writing and oral communication skills

key_responsibilities: managing and coordinating all communications activities, including media contacts, for the Member and the office
requirements: at least 2 years of congressional experience and one year of experience as a Communications Director or Press Secretary
strong writing, editing, and proofreading skills
understanding of print and broadcast media with a current working list of Washington and national media contacts
knowledge of current issues and events in which the Member is involved
ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment in the representation of the Member's positions on policy issues
ability to work well under pressure
ability to work cooperatively and courteously with office staff, constituents, and media

key_responsibilities: handling press inquiries
speech-writing
social media
message development and strategy
requirements: thrive in a fast-moving, aggressive communications environment

office: A Western Republican member of Congress
key_responsibilities: supporting the Representative’s legislative priorities through legislative research, the drafting of legislation, acting as the liaison to the relevant committees, work with the Congressional Research Service, and identifying strategies to advance those legislative priorities
preparing the member for committee hearings, staffing those hearings and monitoring/reporting to the Representative at times when he is unable to attend the meeting
assisting the Representative in preparing for interviews, meetings with constituents and interest groups, as well as note taking at such meetings and follow up action items
drafting answers or preparing outlines of responses to constituent mail
drafting speeches, statements and correspondence with the appropriate executive agencies for review by the Legislative Director, Chief of Staff, and the Representative

developing and justifying co-sponsorship and vote recommendations for review by the Legislative Director and Chief of Staff and for consideration by the Representative for bills in committee, mark up and on the floor in assigned areas of responsibility

coordinating with the legislative team to develop, manage and organize all communications activities, including writing press releases, op-eds, mail pieces, talking points, organizing press events, maintaining the official website, implementing social media strategy, maintaining press database, writing e-newsletters & coordinating Tele-town halls
briefing the Member for interviews
writing and implementing PSAs
interacting with the press as the Member’s principal spokesperson and coordinating the Member’s overall press relations
requirements: proven ability to manage multiple communications projects
ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment in the representation of the Member’s position on policy issues
depth of legislative and policy knowledge including that of the appropriations process

office: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
key_responsibilities: participating in all matters under the Committee’s jurisdiction, including investigations, hearings, depositions, transcribed interviews, and briefings
requirements: attorney with 2-5 years of investigative or litigation experience
able to work well under pressure
excellent written and oral communication skills

key_responsibilities: developing strategies to increase outreach to LES and represent the office at public meetings

office: Democratic Staff of the House Committee on Small Business
key_responsibilities: handling matters including but not limited to agency oversight, procurement, financial services, health, and/or technology
hearing preparation and legislative development
